\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
Protothread definitions for myos. 

Based on Contiki 2.\+7 protothread implementation.

Definition at line 60 of file pt.\+h.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{pt_8h_a2ffbb9e554e08a343ae2f9de4bedfdfc}\label{pt_8h_a2ffbb9e554e08a343ae2f9de4bedfdfc}} 
\index{pt.h@{pt.h}!PT\_BEGIN@{PT\_BEGIN}}
\index{PT\_BEGIN@{PT\_BEGIN}!pt.h@{pt.h}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{PT\_BEGIN}{PT\_BEGIN}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+BEGIN(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pt }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Declare the start of a protothread inside the C function implementing the protothread.

This macro is used to declare the starting point of a protothread. It should be placed at the start of the function in which the protothread runs. All C statements above the \mbox{\hyperlink{pt_8h_a2ffbb9e554e08a343ae2f9de4bedfdfc}{PT\+\_\+\+BEGIN()}} invokation will be executed each time the protothread is scheduled.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em pt} & A pointer to the protothread control structure. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}


Definition at line 120 of file pt.\+h.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{pt_8h_a7b04a0035bef29d905496c23bae066d2}\label{pt_8h_a7b04a0035bef29d905496c23bae066d2}} 
\index{pt.h@{pt.h}!PT\_END@{PT\_END}}
\index{PT\_END@{PT\_END}!pt.h@{pt.h}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{PT\_END}{PT\_END}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+END(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pt }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Declare the end of a protothread.

This macro is used for declaring that a protothread ends. It must always be used together with a matching \mbox{\hyperlink{pt_8h_a2ffbb9e554e08a343ae2f9de4bedfdfc}{PT\+\_\+\+BEGIN()}} macro.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em pt} & A pointer to the protothread control structure. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}


Definition at line 132 of file pt.\+h.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{pt_8h_a905451249dca72ce0385bf2a9ff178ee}\label{pt_8h_a905451249dca72ce0385bf2a9ff178ee}} 
\index{pt.h@{pt.h}!PT\_EXIT@{PT\_EXIT}}
\index{PT\_EXIT@{PT\_EXIT}!pt.h@{pt.h}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{PT\_EXIT}{PT\_EXIT}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+EXIT(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pt }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Exit the protothread.

This macro causes the protothread to exit. If the protothread was spawned by another protothread, the parent protothread will become unblocked and can continue to run.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em pt} & A pointer to the protothread control structure. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{PT\_INIT}{PT\_INIT}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+INIT(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pt }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Initialize a protothread.

Initializes a protothread. Initialization must be done prior to starting to execute the protothread.

Definition at line 76 of file pt.\+h.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{pt_8h_acd3ac045f0a4ae63412e3b3d8780e8ab}\label{pt_8h_acd3ac045f0a4ae63412e3b3d8780e8ab}}

{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+RESTART(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pt }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Restart the protothread.

This macro will block and cause the running protothread to restart its execution at the place of the \mbox{\hyperlink{pt_8h_a2ffbb9e554e08a343ae2f9de4bedfdfc}{PT\+\_\+\+BEGIN()}} call.

Definition at line 217 of file pt.\+h.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{pt_8h_afa82b860a64b67d25ab3abc21811896f}\label{pt_8h_afa82b860a64b67d25ab3abc21811896f}} 
\index{pt.h@{pt.h}!PT\_SCHEDULE@{PT\_SCHEDULE}}
\index{PT\_SCHEDULE@{PT\_SCHEDULE}!pt.h@{pt.h}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{PT\_SCHEDULE}{PT\_SCHEDULE}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+SCHEDULE(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{f }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Schedule a protothread.

This function schedules a protothread. The return value of the function is non-\/zero if the protothread is running or zero if the protothread has exited.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em f} & The call to the C function implementing the protothread to be scheduled \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}


Definition at line 252 of file pt.\+h.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{pt_8h_a9e97a0b4d5cc7764d8e19758f5da53ae}\label{pt_8h_a9e97a0b4d5cc7764d8e19758f5da53ae}}

\index{PT\_SPAWN@{PT\_SPAWN}!pt.h@{pt.h}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{PT\_SPAWN}{PT\_SPAWN}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+SPAWN(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pt,  }\item[{}]{child,  }\item[{}]{thread }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Spawn a child protothread and wait until it exits.

This macro spawns a child protothread and waits until it exits. The macro can only be used within a protothread.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em pt} & A pointer to the protothread control structure. \\
\hline
{\em child} & A pointer to the child protothread\textquotesingle{}s control structure. \\
\hline
{\em thread} & The child protothread with arguments \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+THREAD(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{name\+\_\+args }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Declaration of a protothread.

This macro is used to declare a protothread. All protothreads must be declared with this macro.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}

Definition at line 105 of file pt.\+h.

\mbox{\Hypertarget{pt_8h_a2f8f70c30b9ee08a103fbd69a4365c4c}\label{pt_8h_a2f8f70c30b9ee08a103fbd69a4365c4c}} 
\index{pt.h@{pt.h}!PT\_WAIT\_THREAD@{PT\_WAIT\_THREAD}}
\index{PT\_WAIT\_THREAD@{PT\_WAIT\_THREAD}!pt.h@{pt.h}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{PT\_WAIT\_THREAD}{PT\_WAIT\_THREAD}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+WAIT\+\_\+\+THREAD(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pt,  }\item[{}]{thread }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Block and wait until a child protothread completes.

This macro schedules a child protothread. The current protothread will block until the child protothread completes.

\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
The child protothread must be manually initialized with the \mbox{\hyperlink{pt_8h_ae6bae7dc0225468c8a5ac269df549892}{PT\+\_\+\+INIT()}} function before this function is used.
\end{DoxyNote}

\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em pt} & A pointer to the protothread control structure. \\
\hline
{\em thread} & The child protothread with arguments\\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxySeeAlso}{See also}
\mbox{\hyperlink{pt_8h_a9e97a0b4d5cc7764d8e19758f5da53ae}{PT\+\_\+\+SPAWN()}} 
\end{DoxySeeAlso}

Block and wait until condition is true.

This macro blocks the protothread until the specified condition is true.

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{PT\_YIELD}{PT\_YIELD}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \#define PT\+\_\+\+YIELD(\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{}]{pt }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}

Yield from the current protothread.

This function will yield the protothread, thereby allowing other processing to take place in the system.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em pt} & A pointer to the protothread control structure. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
